required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spectral CT With Advanced CT Technology
clinical_study.official_title: Spectral Computed Tomography With Photon-counting Detector

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to collect data to evaluate feasibility of the using photon-counting CT in a clinical setting.

detailed_description.textblock: Data collected in this study includes an assessment of image quality parameters including spatial resolution, image contrast, and noise that will evaluate the product and how this photon-counting CT technology can be used to reduce the overall radiation dose in CT imaging, and enhance clinical applications for CT technology.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The single group model will enroll subjects from 5 anatomical areas (lungs, brain/carotid vessels, heart/chest, MSK and abdomen) where CT imaging is applicable and where data on the photon-counting CT is needed to assess feasibility and guide further development of the technology.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate feasibility of the photon-counting CT in a clinical setting.
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of this study is to collect and evaluate raw CT scan data collected using the photon-counting CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Collect feedback on performance and images generated on the photon-counting CT.
secondary_outcome.description: Gather feedback on the performance and image quality of the reconstructed images produced by using the photon-counting CT.

intervention.description: Enrolled subjects will complete an exam using the photon-counting CT, with or without IV contract as indicated. Images will then be compared with the previously acquired CT conducted as standard of care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >50 years
- Male
- Normal renal function per standardized guidelines (GFR > 60 mL/min)
- Previous CT examination at KS no more than 12 months prior to the study examination
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Iodine contrast is contraindicated.
